title: Type for arrow func based JSX components
interface for props with array of objects
Interface
description: An Interface is a structure which acts as a contract in our application. It defines the syntax for classes to follow, means a class which implements an interface is bound to implement all its members.

title: Event Object
description: React uses its own event system. That’s why you can’t use typical MouseEvents or similar on your elements. You need to use the specific React version, otherwise you get a compile error. Luckily, React typings give you the proper equivalent of each event you might be familiar with from standard DOM. Events supported are: AnimationEvent, ChangeEvent, ClipboardEvent, CompositionEvent, DragEvent, FocusEvent, FormEvent, KeyboardEvent, MouseEvent, PointerEvent, TouchEvent, TransitionEvent, WheelEvent and SyntheticEvent. The Type for event object is: React.TypeOfTheEvent<HTMLInputElement>

title: React State
description: For state we use angle brackets to define its type.

title: Type for refs
description: To set type for ref we use the type of target element. ex: const inputRef = useRef<HTMLInputElement | null>(null)
